StepDescription: Ensure ethernet cable is connceted to Internet
Plug the other port to IoT device
Check if wget http://www.kernel.org/pub/linux/bluetooth/bluez-5.30.tar.xz
ExpectedResult: wget command works

StepDescription: Ensure WLAN port of the wifi AP is connected to Internet
Connect to the WiFi AP
On IoT device, wget http://www.kernel.org/pub/linux/bluetooth/bluez-5.30.tar.xz
ExpectedResult: wget command works

Description: connect to an encrypted (WPA PSK) AP
StepDescription: Prepare a WPA-PSK WiFi AP nearby
connmanctl scan wifi && connmanctl services
ExpectedResult: It will print a list of services

StepDescription: From the services list, find the AP's service string. Do connmanctl connect <service string>
ExpectedResult: connect should return succeed

StepDescription: After a while, check if IoT could get IP adress from the AP.
ExpectedResult: IoT device should get IP address (192.168.x.x)

Description: connect to an encrypted (WPA2 PSK) AP
StepDescription: Prepare a WPA2-PSK WiFi AP nearby
connmanctl scan wifi && connmanctl services
ExpectedResult: It will print a list of services

StepDescription: From the services list, find the AP's service string. Do connmanctl connect <service string>
ExpectedResult: connect should return succeed

StepDescription: After a while, check if IoT could get IP adress from the AP.
ExpectedResult: IoT device should get IP address (192.168.x.x)

StepDescription: On IoT device, enable BT device by 'hciconfig hci0 up' and 'hciconfig hci0 piscan'.
ExpectedResult: hciconfig hci0 should see "UP RUNNING PSCAN ISCAN"

StepDescription: Run bluetoothctl. In the console, input 'agent on'.
On the Host, do same step1 and step2.
ExpectedResult: hciconfig hci0 should see "UP RUNNING PSCAN ISCAN"

StepDescription: In bluetoothctl console, input 'pair <IoT BT MAC>'
When the agent ask PIN, input 1234 and the other peer also input 1234.
ExpectedResult: BT pair should be established.

Description: use gatttool to connect IoT device
StepDescription: IoT device does ble advertising. Command is: hciconfig hci0 leadv
On Host, gatttool -b <iot BT MAC> -I
ExpectedResult: It should enter gatttool console mode

StepDescription: In the gatttool console, input 'connect'
ExpectedResult: the connect should succeed after several seconds

Description: use gatttool to read IoT BLE primary info
StepDescription: IoT device does ble advertising. Command is: hciconfig hci0 leadv
On Host, gatttool -b <iot BT MAC> --primary
ExpectedResult: It will list IoT device primary info

Description: use gatttool to read IoT BLE characteristics info
StepDescription: IoT device does ble advertising. Command is: hciconfig hci0 leadv
On Host, gatttool -b <iot BT MAC> --characteristics
ExpectedResult: It will list IoT device characteristics info

Description: use gatttool to read IoT BLE handle value
StepDescription: IoT device does ble advertising. Command is: hciconfig hci0 leadv
On Host, gatttool -b <iot BT MAC> --characteristics

In the characteristics list, use a handle to see its value. Command is: 
gatttool -b <iot BT MAC> --char-read -a <handle>
ExpectedResult: It should read out the handle's value.

Description: use gatttool to write IoT BLE handle value
StepDescription: IoT device does ble advertising. Command is: hciconfig hci0 leadv
On Host, gatttool -b <iot BT MAC> --characteristics

In the characteristics list, use a handle to see its value. Command is: 
gatttool -b <iot BT MAC> --char-read -a <handle>

Write new value into the handle by:
gatttool -b <iot BT MAC> --char-write-req -a <handle> -n abcd
ExpectedResult: return write success

StepDescription:
Read this handle again. 
gatttool -b <iot BT MAC> --char-read -a <handle>
ExpectedResult: the value has been modified to 'ab cd ...'

Description: iotivity client finds resource via WiFi
StepDescription: Connect both IoT device and Host to same AP

On the Host, start iotivity server. Wget iotivity server from http://ostroproject.org/iot/Full/servertest. 
Start it by "./servertest"
ExpectedResult: The server is able to be launched, and wait for client's request.

StepDescription: On IoT device, run /opt/iotivity/apps/iotivity-simple-client/simpleclient
ExpectedResult: It should print out finding resource succeed.
